docs.snippet: Adobe Systems Inc. reported lower third-quarter earnings yesterday that were in line with Wall Street estimates, reflecting slow sales of its publishing and design software for Apple Computer PC's.    Net income fell to $29.8 million, or 40 cents ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Adobe Systems Inc. reported lower third-quarter earnings yesterday that were in line with Wall Street estimates, reflecting slow sales of its publishing and design software for Apple Computer PC's. Net income fell to $29.8 million, or 40 cents a share, including a 5-cent gain from investments, from $33.9 million, or 44 cents.
docs.abstract: Adobe Systems Inc reports lower third-quarter earnings; net income fell to $29.8 million, and revenue fell 1 percent, to $180.9 million (S)

docs.snippet: Adobe Systems Inc. said yesterday that its first-quarter earnings jumped nearly 80 percent on higher software sales and licensing revenue, beating Wall Street estimates.   The provider of electronic publishing software, based in Mountain View, Cal...
docs.lead_paragraph: Adobe Systems Inc. said yesterday that its first-quarter earnings jumped nearly 80 percent on higher software sales and licensing revenue, beating Wall Street estimates. The provider of electronic publishing software, based in Mountain View, Calif., posted net income of almost $34.4 million, or 54 cents a share, compared with $19.1 million, or 31 cents, a year earlier. Analysts had expected earnings of 38 cents a share, according to mean estimates calculated by Zacks Investment Research and IBES International.

headline.main: Adobe Systems Inc.(ADBE,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 26
Adobe Systems Inc.(ADBE,NMS) reports earnings for Qtr to May 27

docs.snippet: Officials broke ground on the $3.3 million, half-acre CaVaLa Park, bounded by Canal, Varick and Laight Streets....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a city where real estate agents, neighborhood boosters and other property-oriented interests seem to be constantly inventing newfangled if odd-sounding place names -- like Dumbo (first New York Times reference: 1984), NoLIta (1996) and SoBro (1988, but re-popularized in 2005) -- it should come as little surprise that the city's parks department has gotten in on the action.
docs.abstract: Officials broke ground on the $3.3 million, half-acre CaVaLa Park, bounded by Canal, Varick and Laight Streets.

headline.main: In TriBeCa, a New Park Called CaVaLa

docs.snippet: The scholarship funds of Wells and Wheaton Colleges will be aided by a theatre benefit being planned by their New York alumnae. It will be the April 28 performance of "Destry Rides Again" at the Imperial Theatre....

docs.snippet: The Rev. WILLIS E. DUDLEY, pastor of the First Congregational Church of Niagara Falls, died yesterday of typhoid fever. He was thirty-five years of age, a former newspaper man, and one of the most popular clergymen of Niagara Falls....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rev. WILLIS E. DUDLEY, pastor of the First Congregational Church of Niagara Falls, died yesterday of typhoid fever. He was thirty-five years of age, a former newspaper man, and one of the most popular clergymen of Niagara Falls.
